definition: to exist over a prolonged period of time
details:
verb
- to exist over a prolonged period of time
= example: to exist over a prolonged period of time
- to continue talking
= example: to continue talking
= synonyms: go on, proceed, carry on
- to move ahead
= synonyms: proceed, go forward
- to allow to remain in a place or position or maintain a property or feature
= example: to allow to remain in a place or position or maintain a property or feature
= synonyms: keep
- to keep or maintain in unaltered condition
= example: to keep or maintain in unaltered condition
= synonyms: preserve
- to continue a certain state, condition, or activity
= example: to continue a certain state, condition, or activity
= synonyms: keep
- to span an interval of distance, space or time
= synonyms: cover
- to remain in a place, position, or situation
= example: to remain in a place, position, or situation
= synonyms: stay
- to continue after an interruption
= example: to continue after an interruption
- to do something repeatedly and showing no intention to stop
= example: to do something repeatedly and showing no intention to stop
= synonyms: persist in
